    • Method Detail

      • makeNode

        public Node<T> makeNode(T data,
               java.lang.String key,
               boolean blocked,
               int cost,
               T goal)
        makes a node given parameters, but does not attach it to the graph
        Parameters:
        data - the int[] of (x,y) coordinates of the node
        key - the "x-y" string made from (x,y) coordinates to uniquely specify a node
        blocked - boolean of whether node is made from a "#"
        cost - the cost of stepping into this node, if it's open
        goal - the coordinates of the goal
        Returns:
        the node that was just made

      • connectNodes

        public void connectNodes(java.lang.String parentKey,
                java.lang.String childKey,
                int indexInParentChildsList)
        connects a child node to a parent. Note that the parent contains a hashTable of size four of references to the existing child nodes. Since every node contains such a hashTable referencing all adjacent nodes, the graph contains effectively only 2-way edges.
        Parameters:
        parentKey - the key for the parent, used for hashtable and getting the node
        childKey - the key of the child
        indexInParentChildsList - the direction (up, right, down, left) of the child wrt the parent

      • getNumNodes

        public int getNumNodes()
        getter method
        Returns:
        the number of nodes in the graph

        public void updateTotalCost(java.lang.String key,
                   int cost)
        setter method for the g(n) of reaching a node
        Parameters:
        key - the key of the node
        cost - the new cost, g(n)
